meanings.definition: Covered with prickly spines or bristles.
meanings.sent1: The echinated cactus was not a good plant to touch.
meanings.sent2: The hedgehog's back was echinated with sharp quills.
meanings.sent3: The echinated sea urchin tried to give hugs but ended up poking everyone.
meanings.sent4: His echinated personality made it hard for others to get close to him.
meanings.sent5: The echinated surface felt like a bed of needles underfoot.

meanings.definition: Having a spiny or prickly surface.
meanings.sent1: The echinated shell of the snail provided protection from predators.
meanings.sent2: The echinated texture of the plant deterred animals from eating it.
meanings.sent3: The echinated pineapple looked intimidating but was actually quite sweet inside.
meanings.sent4: Her words had an echinated effect, leaving him feeling hurt and defensive.
meanings.sent5: The echinated surface of the rock made it difficult to climb.
